CatDescriptText: Nathan Herring, student, Hill District and Mrs. L.D. Dumont, state office worker, Glen-Hazel, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 27, 1960, pg. A1 with question "What are the most appealing nad the least appealing aspects of Republican presidential candidate Richard M. Nixon?"  Mr. Herring's answer reads: "His best selling point is the knowledge of the international situation gained from worldwide travels.  However, I don't know as yet who I will vote for in November." Mrs. Dumont's answer reads: " I like the Democrats because of their platform which aims to help the aged and everybody."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Nathan Herring wearing plaid cap and sun patterned shirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Bud Saunders Flower Shop, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Mrs. L.D. Dumont wearing light colored short sleeved top with scalloped edges and sunglasses, standing in front of Empire Building, Downtown
